text: Benjamin Henry Sheares (12 August 1907 - 12 May 1981) was a Singaporean physician and politician. He was the second President of Singapore from 1971 until his death in 1981.Singapore. Parliament. Parliamentary Debates: Official Report. (30 December 1970). Election of President of Republic of Singapore (Vol. 30, cols. 378â€“382); Election of President today. (30 December 1970). The Straits Times, p. 6. Retrieved from NewspaperSG. Sheares died while in a coma at a hospital in Singapore from problems caused by lung cancer on 12 May 1981, aged 73.Sheares in a coma. (11 May 1981). The Straits Times, p. 1; Lee, P., Ngoo, I., & Bala, K. (13 May 1981). Singapore mourns. The Straits Times, p. 1. title: Benjamin Sheares
